block.p: Jessica Ray Buchanan, a daughter of Mr. and Mrs. William H. Buchanan Jr. of New Canaan, Conn., was married yesterday to Philip Christensen Rawlins, a son of Bonnie Rawlins of New Orleans and the late P. J. Thomas Rawlins Jr. The Rev. Charlene S. Alling, an Episcopal priest, officiated at St. Mary's-by-the-Sea Episcopal Church in Northeast Harbor, Me. The Rev. Dr. Gary A. Wilburn, a Presbyterian minister, took part in the ceremony.

Mrs. Rawlins, 28, is an assistant portfolio manager at Derivium Capital, a financial services company in Charleston, S.C. She graduated from Hamilton College. Her father is an executive vice president of Spencer Trask Intellectual Capital, a patents affiliate of Spencer Trask & Company, an investment firm in New York.

Jessica Ray Buchanan, a daughter of Mr. and Mrs. William H. Buchanan Jr. of New Canaan, Conn., was married yesterday to Philip Christensen Rawlins, a son of Bonnie Rawlins of New Orleans and the late P. J. Thomas Rawlins Jr. The Rev. Charlene S. Alling, an Episcopal priest, officiated at St. Mary's-by-the-Sea Episcopal Church in Northeast Harbor, Me. The Rev. Dr. Gary A. Wilburn, a Presbyterian minister, took part in the ceremony.

Mrs. Rawlins, 28, is an assistant portfolio manager at Derivium Capital, a financial services company in Charleston, S.C. She graduated from Hamilton College. Her father is an executive vice president of Spencer Trask Intellectual Capital, a patents affiliate of Spencer Trask & Company, an investment firm in New York.

Mr. Rawlins, 31, owns Expressions Hardwood Floors, a flooring dealership in Charleston. He graduated from the College of Charleston. His mother is a program service coordinator for New Orleans Catholic Charities. His father owned Clean Fuel Systems, a former fuel filtration company in New Orleans.
